data.name: LogonError_InvalidAuthenticationTypeBasicOrDigest
data.value: Verify that you are using the correct authentication type. For Basic and Digest authentication types, the session configuration must allow unencrypted traffic.

data.name: EventLog_ASPNET_SessionTimeout
data.value: ASP.NET Session Time-out

data.name: InternalError_InvalidAuthenticationMechanism
data.value: An internal error in Windows PowerShell Web Access occurred because the authentication type specified for the connection is not valid.

data.name: LogonError_InvalidUri
data.value: Verify the Connection URI for errors. {0}

data.name: EventLog_Logout
data.value: User Signoff

data.name: LogonError_ConnectionErrorExtended
data.value: The Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway cannot establish a connection to the destination computer. Contact the gateway administrator. The error at the gateway is: {0}

data.name: LogonError_InvalidCredentials
data.value: The credentials provided for the destination computer are not valid.

data.name: LogonError_InvalidEndpoint
data.value: Windows PowerShell Web Access cannot connect to the destination computer. Verify that the correct values are specified for computer name, SSL, port and application name. This could also be caused by a network or configuration problem. Contact the gateway administrator, if applicable.

data.name: LogonError_ConnectionError
data.value: The Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway cannot establish a connection to the destination computer. Contact the gateway administrator.

data.name: LogonError_UnknownError
data.value: An unexpected error occurred during the sign-in process. Try signing in again, or contact your system administrator.

data.name: LogonError_LogMessage
data.value: An error occurred during the sign-in process. Error details: {0}

data.name: LogonError_InvalidComputer
data.value: Windows PowerShell Web Access cannot connect to the destination computer. Verify that you entered the destination computer name correctly.

data.name: LogonError_InvalidAuthenticationTypeCredSPP
data.value: Verify that the correct authentication type is specified. For CredSSP, both the Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway and the destination computer must be configured correctly.

data.name: LogonError_RemotingNotEnabled
data.value: The Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway cannot establish a connection to the destination computer. This can happen if Windows PowerShell remote management is not enabled on the destination computer. Consult the event log on the gateway server for more information.

data.name: LogonError_InvalidComputerNameUriFormat
data.value: The computer name is not valid. If you provided a URI, verify that the Connection Type is set accordingly.

data.name: LogonError_ThreadAborted
data.value: The web server interrupted the request. This may be caused by a time-out while trying to establish a connection to the destination computer.

data.name: EventLog_IdleSessionTimeout
data.value: Idle Session Time-out

data.name: LogonError_NoLogonServers
data.value: The Windows PowerShell Web Access gateway cannot establish a connection to the destination computer. The account that was provided could not be authenticated. This can happen if Kerberos authentication is used with a local account, or the gateway server and destination computer are in different domains, and there is no trust relationship between the domains. Contact the gateway administrator.

data.name: LogonError_InvalidConfigurationName
data.value: Windows PowerShell Web Access cannot find the session configuration on the destination computer. Verify that the configuration name is correct.

data.name: UnknownIpAddress
data.value: <none>

data.name: LogonError_UnknownErrorAdminMessage
data.value: An unexpected error occurred while signing in. Error details: {0}

data.name: EventLog_BrowserInitiated
data.value: Initiated by the Browser

data.name: HttpsRequired
data.value: This website uses the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol, and requires an HTTPS address. Please update the URL in your browser.

data.name: LogonError_AccessDenied
data.value: Access to the destination computer has been denied. Verify that you have access to the destination Windows PowerShell session configuration. This error can also occur if Windows PowerShell remote management has been disabled on the destination computer.

data.name: LogonButton_Text
data.value: Sign In

data.name: EventLog_UnknownError
data.value: Internal Server Error

data.name: LogonError_InvalidPort
data.value: The Port field contains a value that is not a valid port number. Valid port numbers are integers.

data.name: LogonError_InvalidCharacterFormat
data.value: One of the input fields contains a character that is not allowed: '\u{0:x}'
